intro: Fremontia californica, commonly known as the California starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Physostegia genus and is characterized by its striking star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in chaparral and woodland areas. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to orange and bloom in late spring to early summer. Fremontia californica is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
